column1: Bagby and Chisholm, Response of Prochlorococcus to varying CO2:O2 ratios, ISME J
Table S2.  Concordance between MED4 transcriptional responses to high light shock, –CO2 shock, and –CO2/–O2 shock
1 Loci for which CyanoBase gene categories were changed by manual curation are marked with an asterisk.

2 Where gene categories were changed by manual curation, original CyanoBase classifications are given in square brackets.  Gene categories:  A, amino acid 
biosynthesis; B, biosynthesis of cofactors, prosthetic groups, and carriers; C, cell envelope; D, cellular processes; E, central intermediary metabolism; F, energy 
metabolism; G, fatty acid, phospholipid, and sterol metabolism; H, photosynthesis and respiration; I, purines, pyrimidines, nucleosides, and nucleotides; J, regulatory 
functions; K, DNA replication, recombination, and repair; L, transcription; O, translation; P, transport and binding proteins; R, RNA; U, other categories; Z, hypothetical 
proteins.

3 At t = 45 min of high light shock.  Changes in expression were assessed by comparison to parallel cultures kept in the dark (Steglich et al., 2006; 
Steglich et al., 2008).
4 Direction of initial change, as indicated by cluster membership:  cluster 1, up; clusters 2, 3, and 4, down.  See Fig. 2C for cluster profiles.
5 As indicated by membership in cluster 3.  See Fig. 2B for cluster profiles.
